div.p: Unit 3, VPRS 780 inward correspondence, Melbourne Observatory, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 25.10.93. To proof.
Melbourne, botanic Garden,

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter, dated 6. June,
find in outwards - if at PRO.
and beg in reply to inform you, that I estimate the cost of trenching the ground to the width of 12' within the periphery of the Observatory-site at £15 (fifteen pounds Sterling).
I shall feel much pleasure to arrange for the performance of the work, whenever I receive your authority

Having learnt in an accidental interview with George Verdon Esq., that also some higher trees will be desirable around the observatory as a more certain barrier against the dust, I have set aside a sufficient number of the umbrageous and rapid-growing W. Australian Eucalyptus calophylla and of eligible elegant pines for the purpose.
